node.title: Biden Will Not Apologize for Linking Rittenhouse to White Supremacy: Psaki
node.description: Psaki sparred with Fox News reporter Peter Doocy during a White House press briefing.

node.title: Florida Resort CEO Punished Maintenance Manager for Hiring Black Employee: Lawsuit
node.description: Management at the resort allegedly told Jacob Hood  "those are not the type of people" after he hired the employee.

node.title: Death toll from Wisconsin Christmas parade tragedy rises to six
node.description: An eight-year-old becomes the sixth person to die in the wake of the incident in the US, where a court has heard witness accounts of the driver intentionally swerving the SUV to hit people.

node.title: Jazz musician Jon Batiste leads expanded field of Grammy nominations
node.description: Jazz musician Jon Batiste leads nominations at the 63rd Annual Grammy Awards in Los Angeles with 11 nods, followed by Justin Bieber, Doja Cat and H.E.R with eight apiece.

node.title: Treaty of Waitangi settlement for Moriori completed
node.description: Moriori chief negotiator, Maui Solomon says the third reading of the Moriori Claims Settlement bill yesterday was a day to celebrate and honour the history of the iwi. Audio

node.title: 'Trust your councillors' says councillor ahead of Oruku Landing decision
node.description: Gavin Benney denies his press release indicating support for a proposed conference and event centre breached the council's elected members' code of conduct.

node.title: 'There's lot of people who are a lot angrier' - Police report large increase in MIQ violence and disorder
node.description: Police figures indicate more than a four-fold increase in violence and disorder in MIQ hotels this year, compared to last year.

node.title: How to Celebrate Pandemic Thanksgiving, Round 2
node.description: Thanksgiving is back, but Covid hasn’t gone away. Here’s how to have a safer, peaceful and tasty holiday.

node.title: Steve Bannon and a Cautionary Tale on Congressional Power
node.description: The actions of the House Committee on Un-American Activities show how Congress’s power to hold witnesses in contempt is a tool prone to abuse.

node.title: Despite vaccines, the U.S. has lost more lives to Covid this year than last.
node.description: The higher death toll is attributed to lower-than-needed vaccination rates and the relaxation of everyday precautions amid a rise of the highly contagious Delta variant.

node.title: Former Soldiers Imprisoned for 1973 Killing of Singer Have Their Sentences Increased
node.description: Six of the 7 ex-Chilean soldiers convicted of the kidnapping, torture and murder of singer and professor Víctor Jara will serve 25 years instead of 18.

node.title: Bail for Darrell Brooks Set at $5 Million as Sixth Victim Dies
node.description: Waukesha County Court Commissioner Kevin Costello said the bail amount was "extraordinarily high" but "warranted."

node.title: Kansas Pushes to Pay Workers Unemployment Benefits if Fired for Not Getting COVID Vaccine
node.description: The legislation would also require employers to give religious exemptions to any worker who files a written request and bars them from questioning the request.

node.title: West Point Grads Demand Fellow Alum Resign as State Rep Over Oath Keepers Membership
node.description: Eastman has been uninvited from events after he drew a comparison between Biden and Adolf Hitler and posted a link to a Holocaust denial site on social media.

node.title: Grandma and Granddaughter Get Matching Tattoos in Adorable Viral Video
node.description: "[M]y family loves it and my grandpa [her husband] jokes around with her about getting a tattoo at 71 calling her his 'biker girlfriend,'" the teen said.

node.title: Ronaldo magic helps Manchester United qualify for Champions League last 16
node.description: After a tumultuous week that included the sacking of manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, Manchester United bounce back to beat Villarreal and qualify for the Champions League knockout stages.

node.title: Oklahoma Inmate Denied Stay of Execution, But Minister Allowed in Chamber During Injection
node.description: A spiritual advisor is allowed to accompany Bigler Stouffer II in the execution chamber and can touch him during his final moments before the execution.

node.title: Nike Cancels Orders Until Summer '22 as Supply Chain Issues Wreak Havoc on Holiday Shopping
node.description: Any holiday orders from Nike that haven't been shipped will not be fulfilled, the athletic apparel retailer said in an email.

node.title: Nightclub Worker Reveals the Odd Items People Leave Behind in Video Viewed 7M Times
node.description: One commenter wrote that the viral clip, which shows the lost possessions of nightclub guests, "feels illegal to watch."

node.title: Hundreds of Google Employees Encourage Co-Workers to Resist Company's Vaccine Mandate
node.description: "I do not believe Google should be privy to the health and medical history of Googlers and the vaccination status is no exception," the manifesto states.

node.title: Man Who Sued Deputy for Running Over Him Fatally Shot by Officer After Grabbing Gun
node.description: After being terminated for conduct violations in 2020, Lionel Womack was shot and killed Monday after disarming and threatening two Kansas City officers.

node.title: Detroit Mayor Warns of 'Serious Problem' if COVID Cases Continue Rising in City
node.description: The number of Detroit residents that were hospitalized with the coronavirus doubled from two to three weeks ago, with 256 residents in the hospital on Tuesday.

node.title: Inmate's 2 Death Sentences Vacated After Judge Declares Him Intellectually Disabled
node.description: Pervis Payne was convicted of fatally stabbing Charisse Christopher and Lacie Jo, her 2-year-old daughter, in Millington, Tennessee, a Memphis suburb.

node.title: Biden's Use of Oil Reserves Likely Too Little, Too Late for Thanksgiving Gas Prices
node.description: The president announced Tuesday that he would tap into 50 million barrels of emergency oil reserves. Will motorists notice during their Thanksgiving travels?

node.title: Victoria has recorded 1,196 new local COVID-19 cases and three deaths
node.description: There are now 9,774 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 482 people have died during the state's current Delta outbreak.

node.title: It's just been declared but what is a La Niña and what does it mean for our weather?
node.description: Invisible to us mere mortals on the ground, the atmosphere is full of giant circulations which transport, mix and disperse air and energy around the world.

node.title: Teenage girl charged with murder after alleged stabbing in Queensland's Gulf
node.description: A teenage girl has been charged with murder in relation to the alleged stabbing of a 16-year-old boy in the remote Aboriginal town of Doomadgee, in Queensland's Gulf region.

node.title: Silver Ferns to travel to England
node.description: The Silver Ferns will travel to London in January for the International Quad Series as a part of their buildup to the Commonwealth Games.

node.title: Helen Clark chides international community's pandemic response

node.title: Kāinga Ora policy forces thousands in payouts to terrorised neighbours
